page.title: 11Attitudes in Kings Heath
page.content: A large number of old people live in Kings Heath. Some in flats, others in specially designed communities such as {Alcester Gardens}. This consists of 8 bungalows housing up to 16. The purpose of placing the elderly in a mixed area was to{encourage young and old to mix} and become aware of the problems and ideas of each. This has not happened. The elderly, in general, find the young rude, disrespectful, unhelpful and immoral. {Great changes in standards} this century mean elderly people have difficulty understanding problems like drug abuse, unemployment and race relations. The elderly in Kings Heath have seen{vast changes in attitudes}in the past 10 years. Shops are more impersonal with quality and courtesy on the decline. A local pensioner is pessimistic, though sympathetic, about the future for the youth of today.
